images.copyright: Christmas decorations in Warsaw, Poland, for Christmas Day  (© David Milsen/Alamy)
images.title: Merry and bright
images.caption: Merry and bright
images.desc: Germans began decorating Christmas trees with candles as far back as the 1700s, but people wouldn't begin stringing trees with electric lights until the late 1800s. US inventor Thomas Edison created the first practical incandescent lights and used them to decorate his laboratory in 1880. Three years later, the vice president of Edison's company, Edward H Johnson, had Christmas tree bulbs especially made for the Christmas tree in his New York City home.
